meanings.definition: A layer of material, naturally or artificially formed.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologists uncovered ancient stratums of rock during the excavation.
meanings.sent2: The soil in the garden is composed of several stratums of different minerals.
meanings.sent3: The stratums of cake in the bakery window tempted passersby with their delicious layers.
meanings.sent4: As the artist painted, she carefully added stratums of color to create depth in her masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The stratums of clouds in the sky created a beautiful sunset painting.

meanings.definition: A level or class in a social hierarchy.
meanings.sent1: In the school, students from different stratums of society come together to learn.
meanings.sent2: The royal family belonged to the highest stratum of society.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, people dressed up as various stratums of society, from kings to peasants.
meanings.sent4: The CEO's office was located on the top floor, symbolizing his position in the corporate stratum.
meanings.sent5: The stratums of society mingled at the community event, showing unity among diverse groups.
